steps.title: Landing on Invoify home page
details: Every test begins by successfully loading https://invoify.vercel.app in the browser.
No hard technical errors; page renders, but multiple visual ‘looks-off’ issues are captured (mis-aligned labels, inconsistent padding, placeholder text).

steps.title: Attempt to open Invoice Wizard – Step 1: “Bill From” / “Bill To”
details: Tests that look for headings “Bill From :” or “Bill To :” time-out (element not found).
Result: Users cannot progress beyond the first step of invoice creation.

steps.title: Template selection & live preview load
details: Locators for header text (“BETA English Toggle theme”) and template radio buttons are not found.
Live preview panel does appear in some flows, but real-time updates fail once data is edited.

steps.title: Logo upload in templates
details: The UI element for uploading a logo is missing/hidden; tests abort at this point.

steps.title: Wizard step navigation synchronisation
details: Button “1 . From & To” is not clickable (timeout).
Live preview does not sync when users move between wizard steps.

steps.title: Signature – draw, type, upload
details: Canvas for drawing signature not visible.
Typed-signature section & upload area not found.
Users would be blocked from adding a signature.

steps.title: Financial calculations – line items, tax, discount, shipping
details: Sections “3 . Line Items”, “Tax Calculation”, calculation fields (Subtotal, Total) not visible within timeout.

steps.title: PDF generation & Email distribution
details: Primary invoice sections load but key form areas (e.g., “Bill From”) still missing, preventing PDF generation.
Dashboard header expected text (“Dashboard”) not present, halting email-send flow.

steps.title: Multi-format export (JSON/CSV/XML)
details: Invoice date renders as “Invalid Date”, causing dashboard validation to fail early.

emotional_arc: Confidence at page load → mild concern at visual inconsistencies → sharp frustration when core sections (Bill From, Bill To, Line Items, Signature, etc.) never appear → repeated failure to proceed amplifies distrust in the product’s reliability → abandonment.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Missing / renamed DOM elements (e.g., “Bill From :”, “Bill To :”)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Automated and manual users rely on clear, predictable headings to orient themselves. If these are absent or renamed, users feel lost and flows break.
next_actions: Audit current UI copy vs. design spec; reinstate or update headings.
Add data-test-id attributes to critical sections to keep tests & users resilient to copy tweaks.
Run moderated usability session to verify discoverability of Step 1 sections.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Visual consistency – alignment, spacing, button styling
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Uneven UI erodes professionalism and forces users to spend extra cognitive effort locating fields.
next_actions: Introduce a spacing & typography scale in CSS/Design System.
Run linting/CI checks for style regressions.
Standardise button component sizes/variants across pages.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Live preview not updating after edits
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Real-time feedback is a marquee feature; if updates lag or fail, users doubt data integrity.
next_actions: Implement debounced state sync between form and preview.
Write unit tests for each field → preview mapping.
Show loading/error states when preview cannot refresh.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Signatures are legally required on many invoices; hiding these controls blocks users from completing tasks.
next_actions: Ensure signature canvas & typed/upload tabs are visible in default viewport.
Provide fallback text (“Your browser does not support canvas…”) with guidance.
Validate that uploaded images display in preview and PDFs.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Generic or missing placeholders (“Placeholder text”) don’t guide data entry; absent validation messaging leaves users guessing.
next_actions: Replace lorem placeholders with real examples (e.g., “ACME Corp.”).
Add inline validation that appears instantly on blur/focus.
Localise copy consistently (avoid mixed “EnglishToggle theme” strings).

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Sections often loaded after 5-s timeouts in tests. Real users on slower networks will face the same blank screens.
next_actions: Lazy-load heavy components only when needed.
Show skeleton loaders while the wizard initialises.
Profile and optimise bundle size.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Displaying “Invalid Date” kills trust and blocks export workflows.
next_actions: Add date-parsing fallback and locale testing.
Include automated regression tests for date rendering.
Give users manual date picker to correct bad defaults.

first_tackles.description: Restore visibility of core wizard headings (“Bill From”, “Bill To”, “Line Items”) and add stable data-test-ids.
Fix date formatting bug that shows “Invalid Date” and blocks dashboards/export.
Standardise global spacing and button styles to eliminate most ‘looks-off’ UI review flags.
Ensure signature canvas/component mounts by default; add clear fallback text if unsupported.
Set up real-time preview state listener to guarantee immediate reflection of form edits.
